creator: joerg@dorchain.net
text:
I found myself in a situation where I wanted to apply settings to all except a
certain URL. I found no real workaround but to list each and every location,
having to note that future expansions also needs setting instead of inheriting
defaults. While it is possible to negate a regex, this reads ugly.
LocationMatchExcept would be a friendly alternative. E.g. <LocationMatchExcept
^/not-this> instead of <LocationMatch
^/(([^n]|n[^o]|no[^t]|not[^-]|...|not-thi[^s]).+|.{1,8}$)

This is also usually possible using negative-lookahead regexes (see the PCRE man
page or the perl regex docs).  But that is a little less than obvious, and it is
a frequently-requested feature, so I'll leave this bug open either to improve
the docs, or to actually add a simpler way of implimenting this.
creator: slive@apache.org

text:
Thank you for this hint. Much easier to read, and actually works. Adding a
sentence like "For maching everything except, you can use negative-lookahead
(see perlre man page), e.g. <LocationMatch "^/(?!not-this)">" would IMHO help

With reference to bug 37620, the same applies there.

Thanks for the help.
